results.definition: reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot
perceive with the senses quickly, suddenly, or momentarily
examples: ears open to catch every sound

results.definition: perceive by hearing
the act of catching an object with the hands
examples: Mays made the catch with his back to the plate

results.definition: a drawback or difficulty that is not readily evident
examples: it sounds good but what's the catch?

results.definition: suffer from the receipt of
examples: She will catch hell for this behavior!

results.definition: see or watch
take hold of so as to seize or restrain or stop the motion of
hear, usually without the knowledge of the speakers
succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase
to hook or entangle
apprehend and reproduce accurately
the quantity that was caught
a restraint that checks the motion of something
attract and fix
capture as if by hunting, snaring, or trapping
detect a blunder or misstep
the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect
attract; cause to be enamored
catch up with and possibly overtake
grasp with the mind or develop an understanding of
a break or check in the voice (usually a sign of strong emotion)
a cooperative game in which a ball is passed back and forth
examples: he played catch with his son in the backyard

results.definition: a fastener that fastens or locks a door or window
anything that is caught (especially if it is worth catching)
examples: he shared his catch with the others

results.definition: become aware of
be struck or affected by
be the catcher
cause to become accidentally or suddenly caught, ensnared, or entangled
check oneself during an action
examples: She managed to catch herself before telling her boss what was on her mind

results.definition: contract
delay or hold up; prevent from proceeding on schedule or as planned
discover or come upon accidentally, suddenly, or unexpectedly; catch somebody doing something or in a certain state
get or regain something necessary, usually quickly or briefly
reach in time
examples: I have to catch a train at 7 o'clock

results.definition: spread or be communicated
start burning
take in and retain
examples: We have a big barrel to catch the rainwater
